structure.unit: Registration Of Certain Professions And Occupations

law.catch_line: Investigations; Revocation, Suspension, Or Cancellation Of License; Notice, Hearing, Order, Review

text.section: is guilty of an offense against any provision of the laws of the commonwealth relating to the practice of psychology or any rule or regulation adopted thereunder;

is guilty of conduct that places into question the psychologistâ€™s competence to practice psychology, including but not limited to gross misconduct in the practice of psychology or of practicing psychology fraudulently, or beyond its authorized scope, or with gross incompetence, or with gross negligence on a particular occasion or negligence on repeated occasions;
is guilty of practicing psychology while the ability to practice was impaired by alcohol, drugs, physical disability or mental instability;

is guilty of being habitually drunk or being or having been within a reasonable period of time addicted to, dependent on, or a habitual user of narcotics, barbiturates, amphetamines, hallucinogens, or other drugs having similar effects;

is guilty of knowingly permitting, aiding or abetting an unlicensed individual to perform activities requiring a license for purposes of fraud, deception or personal gain, excluding activities permissible under any provision of laws of the commonwealth or rules or regulations of the board;
has been convicted of a criminal offense which reasonably calls into question his ability to practice psychology; or
is guilty of violating any rule or regulation of the board governing the practice of psychology.
